item.title: [C++] Array Initialization
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

sizeof() does not return the amount of items in the array. It returns the amount of memory used to describe the object. So since you declared it as

int item[6];

ints are 4-bytes large, and since there are 6 of them, 6 * 4 = 24.

To get the length, you’re going to have to do something like

int entries = sizeof(p.items) / sizeof(int);

item.title: [C++] Array Initialization
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

You can’t call the size function on an array. There’s no such thing.

You’ll have to use sizeof(array) / sizeof(array[0]).

This takes the size of the entire array and divides it by the size of the first element. As all other elements will be of the same type, you will retrieve the total number of elements in the array.

Alright so this doesn’t make any sense to me. I’m trying to make an array with a length of 6 for testing purposes. I have removed all of the code for that testing from this project to see if anything was affecting this which it didn’t. I don’t know if I’m being retarded or what but when I declare an array with a size, it doesn’t make it the correct size.

[code=cpp]#include

using namespace std;

class Player {
public:
static const int MAX_ITEMS = 6;
int items[MAX_ITEMS];
};

int main() {

Player p;

cout << sizeof(p.items) <<endl;

The output from this program is 24 which makes no sense as it’s supposed to print out 6, correct? I’ve tried 1 too and it gave me a size of 4. When I print out the contents of the array its also filled with nonsense numbers that I didn’t provide. I’m pretty new to C++ and this really makes no sense… Any ideas?

4 bytes in an integer. 4 bytes per integer * 6 elements = 24 bytes.

[code=cpp]#include

using namespace std;

class Player {
public:
static const int MAX_ITEMS = 6;
int items[MAX_ITEMS];
};

int main() {

Player p;

int size = sizeof(p.items) / sizeof(p.items[0])

cout << size <<endl;

return 0;

}[/code]

Try that.[/quote]

But doesn’t that just make the size be printed out as what I want it do be and not as I actually want it? How can I make it so that there are only 6 elements or is that not possible?
